text: Pain Management Specialist Professional Statement Manhattan Pain Medicine offers complete and individualized care for any pain, including neck/back, joints, sports injuries or headaches. Please include your insurance ID when booking an appointment so that we may verify coverage. We take the time needed to carefully diagnose and treat complex pain conditions. Medications, physical therapy, injections, and alternative options are all considered. We also offer ultrasound examination in the office. The goal of the initial evaluation is to determine the precise cause(s) of pain or functional impairment. Our treatments then aim to fix the source of the problem, promote healing, prevent recurrence, and restore quality of life. All your care will be handled by Dr. Jason Siefferman, board certified in Physical Medicine & Rehabilitation and Interventional Pain Management, and Clinical Assistant Professor in the Department of Anesthesiology, Division of Pain Medicine at New York University. Dr. Siefferman completed his training at Rush Medical College in Chicago and Mt. Sinai School of Medicine in New York and scored in the top 1% nationally on the board certification exam. In addition to Manhattan Pain Medicine, he also works in the VA Hospital system, caring for veterans with a wide range of painful conditions. For those who have found themselves on large doses of opioid medications, we specialize in treating pain while weaning opioids without discomfort, including the use of Suboxone. You work only with the doctor and will have direct access to the doctor via email for follow-up questions. More than a year ago by a Verified Patient Bedside Manner Wait Time I have been a patient of Dr Siefferman for the past year and my experience has been AWESOME! An accident years ago left me with multiple spinal injuries and severe chronic pain / physical neurological weaknesses. Before seeing Dr. S. I had already had Spinal Fusion surgery, Arthroscopic Spinal surgery, many many Interventional procedures and tried "every" pain medication regimen out there. I was using Docs. at NYC's best hospitals / Pain Mgmt. groups, yet was still on a slew of pain medications and still in terrible pain. During my 1st visit Dr. Siefferman suggested I try to wean off the mix of pain meds I was taking to see what would happen. I could stop reducing the meds at anytime if I felt things were getting worse, after so many years on meds. (and still in pain) it made sense to try something else. He said he would be available via phone, text & email 24/7 to insure I was comfortable (he was). We would replace the meds with many types of interventional procedures, physical therapy and other non drug modalities - the results have been AMAZING! Dr. S. spends 30 - 40 minutes with me during office visits and he responds to my emails / phone calls promptly. He is patient, engaged and is concerned with all aspects of my health. He has referred me to other health professionals and all of the practitioners have been really solid as well. When I have seen him during pain flair ups he gave me (trigger point, "anesthetic" injections) in the office that provided immediate relief. If pain has put a crimp in your life reach out to Dr. Siefferman, he offers "concierge" medical service and a huge toolbox of treatments. Dr. S has improved the quality of my life immeasurably!
